pages.text: Auroralumina attenboroughii comes from the Upper Ediacaran, with fossils found from the Charnwood Forest, UK. It is not only currently the earliest known predator on Earth, but also the oldest-crown group cnidarian, and could grow up to 20 cm in height.

The generic name derives from the Latin words 'Aurora', to mean 'dawn'; and 'lumina', to mean 'light'. The specific name derives from the Latinised surname of Sir David Attenborough, who went to school within the region the fossil was found in.
